info.title: Assembly API
info.description: Assembly (formely PromisePay) is a powerful payments engine custom-built for marketplaces.

get.description: Show details of a specific Address using a given ID.
/request_token
/request_session_token
Show details of a specific **Bank Account** using a given `:id`.

delete.description: Redact a **Bank Account** using a given `:id`. Redacted **Bank Accounts** can no longer be used as a funding source or a Disbursement destination.

patch.description: When penny verification is enabled, this API call sends two penny transactions to the specified bank account for verification. **Note**: This API call is not required when your platform has automatic penny verification enabled, as this is instead done by the system. Penny credit verification is only supported for US platforms.

get.description: /bank_accounts/:id/transactions

post.description: Create a **Bank Account** to be used as either a funding source or a Disbursement destination. Store the returned `:id` and use it for a `make_payment` **Item Action** call. The `:id` is also referred to as a `token` when involving **Bank Accounts**.

parameters.name: routing_number
parameters.description: *Required conditionally* - Routing number / SWIFT code / BSB number. See Bank account formats by country.

parameters.name: account_number
parameters.description: Account number / IBAN. See Bank account formats by country.

parameters.name: payout_currency
parameters.description: ISO 4217 alpha-3 currency code. This parameter determines the currency with which funds are paid out.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: ISO 4217 alpha-3 currency code. This is an optional field and if not provided, the item will be created with the default currency of the marketplace.

patch.description: When penny verification is enabled, this API call verifies the two penny transactions that were sent to a specified bank account using **Send Penny Amount**. **Note**: This API call requires you to provide a front-end interface to your end-users into which they can input the penny amounts required for a successful verification. Your front-end interface should then pass the information into this API call. Penny credit verification is only supported for US platforms.

parameters.name: amount_1
parameters.description: First penny amount in cents. Can range from 1 to 30 cents.

parameters.name: amount_2
parameters.description: Second penny amount in cents. Can range from 1 to 30 cents.

get.description: Show the **User** the **Bank Account** is associated with using a given `:id`.
Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of existing **Batch Transactions**. The list can be filtered by **Account**, **Batch ID**, **Item**, and **Transaction Type**.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to offset. Required for pagination.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Bank, Card, PayPal or Wallet Account ID.

parameters.name: batch_id
parameters.description: Batch ID. This appears on a bank reference.

parameters.name: transaction_type_method
parameters.description: The method the transaction was carried out with.

get.description: /batch_transactions/:id/paypal_accounts
/batch_transactions/:id/card_accounts
/batch_transactions/:id/wallet_accounts
/batch_transactions/:id/bank_accounts
/batch_transactions/:id/fees
Show Batch Transaction
/batch_transactions/:id/items
/batch_transactions/:id/users
Show details of a specific **Callback** using a given `:id`.

delete.description: Delete an existing Callback using a given `:id`.

patch.description: Update an existing **Callback** using a given `:id`. You can change the `URL`, the `object_type` and whether the **Callback** is `enabled` or `disabled`.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL to which the callbacks will notify

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Object or entity to which the callbacks refer

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Toggle whether callback is active or inactive

get.description: Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of all created **Callbacks**.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Narrow down records to relevant character string

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to offset. Required for pagination.

post.description: Create a **Callback** to notify you at the `URL` when the `object_type` changes

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL to which the callbacks will notify

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Object or entity to which the callbacks refer

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Toggle whether callback is active or inactive

post.description: Create a Credit **Card Account** to be used as a funding source. Store the returned `:id` and use it for a `make_payment` **Item Action** call. The `:id` is also referred to as a **token** when involving Credit Cards.

parameters.name: full_name
parameters.description: User full name with at least a space

get.description: Show the **User** the Credit **Card Account** is associated with using a given `:id`.

patch.description: Where pre-authentication is enabled on a platform, verifies a **Card Account** when a **Card Account** is successfully verified, its verification status is `verified`.

get.description: /card_accounts/:id/transactions

Show details of a specific Credit **Card Account** using a given `:id`. You can toggle the card account number display to show the first 6 digits in addition to the last 4 digits. Contact Assembly if you want to toggle the card account display.

delete.description: Redact a Credit **Card Account** using a given `:id`. Redacted Credit **Card Accounts** can no longer be used as a funding source.

get.description: Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of existing **Companies**.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to offset. Required for pagination.

post.description: Create a **Company** associated with the **User** using a given `user_id`. **Note**: Some parameters are required for KYC. See our guide on Onboarding a Seller for more information.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: User ID to associate with the company

get.description: Show details of a specific **Company** using a given `:id`.

patch.description: Update an existing **Company** attributes using a given `:id`.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: User ID company is associated with

get.description: Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of existing **Direct Debit Authorities**.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to offset. Required for pagination.

post.description: Create a **Direct Debit Authority** associated with a **Bank Account**. The **Direct Debit Authority** is required to use a **Bank Account** as a funding source (Direct Debit/ACH).

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount for direct debit in cents

get.description: Show details of a specific **Direct Debit Authority** using a given `:id`.
Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of existing **Fees**.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to offset. Required for pagination.

post.description: Create a **Fee** to be associated with an **Item**. **Fees** will add or subtract from the **Item** amount based on the **User**, payment type or Disbursement account type. **Fees** can be `Fixed` or `Percentage` based. **Fees** can be capped, have a maximum amount and/or a minimum amount.

parameters.name: fee_type_id
parameters.description:
Fee type:
  1. Fixed
  2. Percentage
  3. Percentage with Cap
  4. Percentage with Min

get.description: Show details of a specific **Fee** using a given `:id`. If the `item_amount` is specified, the response also shows the `calculated_fee` based on a percentage of the `item_amount`.

parameters.name: item_amount
parameters.description: The cost of the item in cents on which the calculated Fee is based

get.description: Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of **Charges**.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to offset. Required for pagination.

post.description: Create a **Charge**. **Charges** require a specified **Card Account** or **Bank Account**. You may pass through an existing **User**, or define the `user_id` of the new user that will be associated with the **Charge** and the provided Account. The `user_id` can be left blank if you wish for a new user to be created for the **Charge**, or specified if you wish for a new **User** to be created with the passed `user_id`.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Bank Account or Card Account ID

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The cost being charged in cents.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email of the user associated with the account being charged.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code of the User being charged.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Description of the Charge being created.

parameters.name: fee_ids
parameters.description: A comma separated list of fee IDs to apply

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: ISO 4217 alpha-3 currency code. This is an optional field and if not provided, the item will be created with the default currency of the marketplace.

parameters.name: retain_account
parameters.description: True - Enables the account to be charged in the future. False - Redacts the account after this charge.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Device Information provided by Assembly client-side SDKs

parameters.name: ip_address
parameters.description: IP Information provided by Assembly client-side SDKs

parameters.name: custom_descriptor
parameters.description: When `custom_descriptors` are enabled, this is the information to appear on credit card and direct debit statements.

get.description: Show details of a specific **Charge** using a given `:id`.
Show status of a specific **Charge** using a given `:id`.
Show the buyer **User** associated with the **Charge** using a given `:id`.
Show details of your **Platform**, providing access to your configuration and related **User** and **Company**.
Show the User the **PayPal Account** is associated with using a given `:id`.
/paypal_accounts/:id/transactions
Show details of a specific **PayPal Account** using a given `:id`.

delete.description: Redact a **PayPal Account** using a given `:id`. Redacted **PayPal Accounts** can no longer be used as a Disbursement destination.

post.description: Create a **PayPal Account** to be used as a Disbursement destination.
Create a token, either for a bank or a card account, that can be used with the **PromisePay.js** package to securely send Assembly credit card details.

get.description: /session
Validate a US bank routing number before creating an account. This can be used to provide on-demand verification, and further information of the bank information a User is providing.
Displays a health check of the Assembly service.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Bank, Card, PayPal or Wallet Account ID.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to offset. Required for pagination.

/transactions/:id

TBC - Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of existing platform **Disbursements**.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Bank, Card, PayPal or Wallet Account ID.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to offset. Required for pagination.

get.description: Show details of a specific **Disbursement** using a given `:id`.
TBC - Show the **User** who received a specifc disbursement.
TBC - Shows the transactions included in a specific **Disbursement**.
TBC - Show the *Wallet Account** that funds were disbursed from.
TBC - Show the **PayPal Account** where funds are expected to be disbursed to after batch processing.
Show Disbursement Items
TBC - Show the **Bank Account** where funds are expected to be disbursed to after batch processing.
Show the users active card account using a given `:id`.

patch.description: /users/:id/payment_account

get.description: Show details of a specific User using a given `:id`.

patch.description: Update an existing **Users** attributes using a given `:id`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID that can be generated by the platform. Cannot contain . character.

parameters.name: mobile
parameters.description: International number format. Include + and no spaces.

patch.description: Sets a users KYC state to `approved` on pre-live given the **User** `:id`. Ensure that a **User** has the required KYC information before using this call, otherwise the call will fail. **Note**: This API call will only work in our pre-live environment. The KYC workflow holds for all users in production.

get.description: Shows the users active bank account using a given `:id`.

patch.description: Set the **Users Disbursement Account** using a given **User** `:id` and one of either a **Bank Account** `:account_id` or a **PayPal Account** `:account_id`.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Account ID (Bank account or PayPal account)

patch.description: /users/:id/mobile_pin

get.description: Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of existing **Users**.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to offset. Required for pagination.

post.description: Create a **User**. **Users** can be associated with **Items** either as a buyer or a seller. **Users** cant be both the buyer and seller for the same **Item**. **Note**: Some parameters are required for KYC. See our guide on Onboarding a Seller for more information.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID that can be generated by the platform. Cannot contain . character.

parameters.name: mobile
parameters.description: International number format. Include + and no spaces.

get.description: Show a **Users PayPal Account** using a given `:id`.
Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of existing **Items** the **User** is associated with using a given `:id`.
Show the **Users Wallet Account** using a given `:id`.
/wallet_accounts/:id/users
TBC - List all disbursements generated for a **Wallet Account**.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to offset. Required for pagination.

get.description: TBC - List all transactions made from a **Wallet Account**.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to offset. Required for pagination.

post.description: Withdraw funds from a **Wallet Account** to a specified disbursement account.
Deposit funds to a **Wallet Account** from a specified payment account.

get.description: Show details of a specific **Wallet Account** using a given `:id.`
List Items

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of records to offset. Required for pagination.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200.

post.description: Create an **Item**. Items require two **Users**, a buyer and a seller. The payment type can be one of **Escrow**, **Express**, **Escrow Partial Release** or **Approve**. The `buyer_id` and `seller_id` are your unique user identifiers.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID that can be generated by the platform. Cannot contain . character. Contact Assembly support if you want item IDs to be generated automatically.

parameters.name: payment_type
parameters.description:
Payment type:
  1. Escrow
  2. Express
  3. Escrow Partial Release
  4. Approve

parameters.name: fee_ids
parameters.description: A comma separated list of fee IDs to apply

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency code. ISO 4217 alpha-3 currency code. This is an optional field and if not provided, the item will be created with the default currency of the marketplace.

parameters.name: tax_invoice
parameters.description: Toggle to generate tax invoice once Item is complete

parameters.name: due_date
parameters.description: When the Item payment is due (DD/MM/YYYY)

parameters.name: custom_descriptor
parameters.description: When `custom_descriptors` are enabled, this is the information to appear on credit card and direct debit statements.

get.description: Show details of a specific **Item** using a given `:id`.

delete.description: Delete an existing **Item** using a given `:id`.

patch.description: Update an existing **Items** attributes using a given `:id`. Note: An item can only be updated if its in `pending` state. Once an item has begun a payment process, you cannot update it.

parameters.name: custom_descriptor
parameters.description: When `custom_descriptors` are enabled, this is the information to appear on credit card and direct debit statements.

get.description: /items/:id/paypal_details
Show the seller **User** associated with the **Item** using a given `:id`.
Show the buyer **User** associated with the **Item** using a given `:id`.
Show the **Fees** associated with the **Item** using a given `:id`.
Show the **Item** wire payment details using a given `:id`.

patch.description: Request release of funds held in escrow, from an **Item** with an **Escrow** or **Escrow Partial Release** payment type. This will transition the **Item** state to `work_completed`.

get.description: /items/:id/paypal_checkout
Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of **Transactions** associated with the **Item** using a given `:id`.
Show the status of an **Item** using a given `:id`.
Show the **Item** BPay payment details using a given `:id`.

patch.description: Make a payment for an **Item**. Pass the `:account_id` of a **Bank Account** or a **Card Account** associated with the **Items** buyer. The **Item** state will transition to one of `payment_held`, `payment_pending`, `payment_deposited` for an **Escrow** or **Escrow Partial Release** payment type. The **Item** state will transition to one of `payment_held`, `payment_pending` or `completed` for an **Express** or **Approve** payment type.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Account id of the bank account/credit card, etc making payment (not user id)

patch.description: Request payment for an **Item**. This can trigger an email or an SMS with instructions for payment. Contact Support if you require email or SMS notifications configured. This will transition the **Item** state to `payment_required`.
Release funds held in escrow from an **Item** with an **Escrow** or **Escrow Partial Release** payment type. This will transition the **Item** state to `completed`.

parameters.name: flag_release
parameters.description: If release flagging enabled for your marketplace

patch.description: Cancel an **Item**. This will transition the **Item** state to `cancelled`. **Items** can only be cancelled if they havent been actioned in any other way.
Acknowledge that funds are being wired for payment. This will transition the Item state to `wire_pending`.
/items/:id/acknowledge_paypal
Revert an `acknowledge wire` *Item Action*. This will transition the **Item** state to `pending`.
Request a refund for an **Item**. This will transition the **Item** status to `refund_flagged`.

parameters.name: refund_amount
parameters.description: For partial refunds, if they are enabled for marketplace.

patch.description: Refund an **Item**s funds held in escrow. An partial `amount` can be specified otherwise the full amount will be refunded. This will transition the **Item** state to refunded if the full amount is refunded, or to the previously held state if a partial `amount` is specified.

parameters.name: refund_amount
parameters.description: For partial refunds, if they are enabled for marketplace.

patch.description: Email a Tax Invoice to the **User** associated with the **Item**.
Raise a dispute for the **Item**. This will transition the **Item** state to `problem_flagged`.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: External ID of user raising dispute

patch.description: Request a Tax Invoice be sent to the **Users** associated with an **Item**.

Where pre-authentication is enabled on a platform, initiates a credit card payment authorization for an item. When an authorization is successful, your platform holds the item amount for capture, but there is no transfer of funds happening. This call is used with the Capture Payment or Void Payment calls.
Where pre-authentication is enabled on a platform, completes a credit card payment for an item whose payment is authorized. This call is used with the Authorize Payment call.

Where pre-authentication is enabled on a platform, voids the `payment_authorized` status for an item. This call is used with the Authorize Payment call. **Note**: Not all payment gateways support the Void Payment API call. In this case, you can wait until a payment authorization expires. A payment authorisation expires after 3 to 6 days if not captured.

description.example: Planting of natives, removal of tree stump.
